result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Brown III

records.addlTxt:
3:21 PM Defendant Matthew Brown III appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by video for Matthew Brown III.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to an in-person hearing today and agrees to use zoom today. Inv. J. Brockway sworn and testified/witness IDs deft via zoom - D, X. State requested certified bail bond in Milwaukee case 22CF2196 that hasn't arrived yet, 2010CF599 Sheboygan case, requests Court take judicial notice on prior convictions in Milwaukee and Sheboygan cases, Atty Derksen has no objection. State rests, requests bindover. Defense objects to bindover, burden not met as to possession. Court finds probable cause, bound over. Information filed/reading waived. NG plea entered all Counts. Court will be issuing standing order on felony cases and sets status date.
Status conference scheduled for February 7, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for February 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on February 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on February 7, 2023 at 01:00 pm.

Current: 4661 N. 27th St., Milwaukee, WI 53209 United States  (Effective: 10-26-2022)
Prior: 1103 Alabama Avenue, Sheboygan, WI 53081

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements; Monitor alcohol abstinence through UA's.
